descript.abstract: 2012 Wards. The dataset contains polygons representing boundaries of District of Columbia 2012 election wards, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. The DC Office of Planning provided the boundaries to the DC GIS program. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE
descript.purpose: This data is used for the planning and management of Washington, D.C. by local government agencies.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

attracc.attraccr: Validated by source and/or responsible agency.

dataqual.logic: Validated by source and/or responsible agency.
dataqual.complete: Validated by source and/or responsible agency.

horizpa.horizpar: Features have been topologically matched to the snapbase where the boundary matched features such as rivers, shoreline, and street centerlines. OCTO took the Office of Planning digitized boundary in between parts that matched the snapbase.

procstep.procdesc: The District Office of Planning updated the ward boundaries to reflect the revised legislation due to the 10 year redistricting effort. OCTO then took those snapped boundaries and selected snapbase feature, such as street centerlines and shoreline, where the boundaries overlapped. Two line files were formed, areas where the boundaries overlapped snapbase features and the original OLP boundary between the snapbase lines. Staff then merged the two layers together, constructed polygons, and appended the basic 2002 attributes to the layer. Note that these boundaries do split certain Census Blocks.

cntorgp.cntorg: Office of the Chief Technology Officer

distinfo.custom: Most DC GIS datasets can be downloaded from "http://dcgis.dc.gov" on the data center page. Orders can also be made by contacting OCTO GIS at "dcgis@dc.gov", especially for datasets not available for download.
